name: sniping
content:
sniping noun [U]
(CRITICISM)
Add to word list
Add to word list
unpleasant criticism: He has been subjected to constant sniping and questioning of his achievements. She is angered by the continual sniping from the sidelines.
More examplesFewer examplesIndividuals need to stop the public sniping.There have been three months of fierce and constant verbal sniping between the pair.He denied that constant media sniping about his erratic leadership style had forced him to act.

sniping noun [U]
(SHOOTING)
the act of shooting at someone from a position where you cannot be seen: They are trained in the use of sniping and other violent tactics. Following a burst of sniping, the Prime Minister threatened to invade if "one more bullet" was fired. See
snipe
More examplesFewer examplesWe had continual sniping until Tuesday.A few people may have shot back, but rumors of widespread sniping were false.Because of their exposure to enemy sniping, Jim's men were unable to remove his body.
